    • isTerminal

      default boolean isTerminal()
      Predicate to determine if the current syntax tree node represents elementary symbol in SysPro formal grammar.

    • token

      Token token()
      Valid only when isTerminal() is true, otherwise returns null.

    • firstTerminal

      default SyntaxNode firstTerminal()
      Find the first descendant node, for which isTerminal() is true.

      The implementation doesn't sort all descendant terminals, only finds the first in tree traversal order. For any correct syntax tree it is equivalent, but faster.

    • lastTerminal

      default SyntaxNode lastTerminal()
      Find the last descendant node, for which isTerminal() is true.

      The implementation doesn't sort all descendant terminals, only finds the last in tree traversal order. For any correct syntax tree it is equivalent, but faster.

    • descendants

      default List<SyntaxNode> descendants(boolean includeSelf)
      Perform tree traversal, returns a list of all found descendants in pre-order: [node, child 0, child 1, ...]. There are no null entries in the output list.

      If includeSelf is false, the output might contain this anyway, if the tree is malformed (contains a loop with this).

      The behavior in the presence of malformed trees (e.g. containing loops) should be considered implementation-defined. This implementation tries to be resilient to malformed trees (e.g. containing arbitrary loops), therefore it skips all malformed subtrees. The checker module doesn't check this method, except via default implementations of firstTerminal() and lastTerminal().

      The algorithm in the current implementation is an iterative DFS with order correction.

      Parameters:
      includeSelf - if true, the output list will include this as the first element
